description: This revised teacup drawing features a hollow handle created with curves instead of filled regions. The cup body remains visible through the handle's empty space. Components are ordered to maintain proper layering.

drawing.description: Cup body. Centered horizontally (600 = (1440-240)/2). Vertical position starts at y=300. Width 240 creates proportional body, height 200 allows space for base and top.
Cup rim. Centered above body (y=300 matches body top). RadiusX=120 matches body width/2, RadiusY=40 creates elliptical opening.
Cup base. Positioned below body (y=500 = 300+200). RadiusX=140 creates wider base than body for stability.
Handle outer curve. Starts at cup's right side (780,350), arcs outward to (900,350), then curves back down. Calculated to maintain 20px clearance from cup body.
Handle inner curve. Parallel to outer curve but 20px closer to cup body. Creates hollow space between handle and cup (800,360) starts 20px inward from outer handle start.
Decorative line 1. Positioned 80px below rim (380 = 300+80). Curved upward at center (y=400) for dynamic pattern.
Decorative line 2. Positioned 30px below first line (430 = 380+50). Mirroring curve creates rhythmic pattern.
Steam line 1. Rises from cup center (720,250). First control point left, then right to create natural wave.
Steam line 2. Mirrors first steam line with opposite curvature. Starts slightly lower (240) for staggered effect.
